channel.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
channel.description:
To prepare for releasing our beehive sensors, we are looking for data scientists interested in analysing bee health data from our sensor network.
If you're a data scientist, please introduce yourself below. We will be in touch when our data becomes available.

item.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
item.author: no-reply@example.com (@AaronM Aaron Makaruk)
item.description:
Aaron Makaruk wrote:

Hi There,

Thanks for coming by.

We'll keep you posted as opportunities arise.

Aaron

Read full topic

item.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
item.author: no-reply@example.com (@dmartinpro David MARTIN)
item.description:
David MARTIN wrote:

Hi, I'm not a pure data scientist but followed several courses about ML and (big) data mining algorithms.

Could be a nice opportunity to try to work on such a dataset.

Read full topic

item.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
item.author: no-reply@example.com (@shellig Shelli Godfrey)
item.description:
Shelli Godfrey wrote:

Yes, I am interested. I apologize for not getting back to you sooner. Am I supposed to get e-mail notification for responses?

Read full topic

item.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
item.author: no-reply@example.com (@AaronM Aaron Makaruk)
item.description:
Aaron Makaruk wrote:

Hi @shellig - welcome to the forum, and thank you for your interest working with us. Do you have any interest in analyzing some audio data? If so, we'll get you an orientation.

Read full topic

item.title: Data Scientists - Introduce Yourself
item.author: no-reply@example.com (@shellig Shelli Godfrey)
item.description:
Shelli Godfrey wrote:

Not a data scientist per se but do a lot of data analysis in my role in Quality Engineering. Good understanding of statistics and data analysis and happy to help if not too overwhelming amount of data I have statistical software available for use (Minitab and JMP) as well as standard Excel analysis tools.

Read full topic
